content.prompt: Which of the following principles was established by the Dred Scott decision?

choices.label: National legislation could not limit the spread of slavery in the territories.
The rights of all people are protected by the Constitution.
Slaves residing in a free state automatically became free.
Through squatter sovereignty, a territory had the sole right to determine the status of slavery within its territorial limits.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify a historical concept, development, or process.
